info.title: Baas Pix
info.description:
**Description**: Api responsible to managing pix keys
# Key kind

  | Kind                | Description                                               |
  |-------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------|
  | `CELLPHONE` | Cellphone number. |
  | `CPF` | CPF number. |
  | `CNPJ` | CNPJ number. |
  | `EMAIL` | E-mail address. |
  | `VIRTUAL` | Random key. |

# Claim Status
To see how the claim flow is going, the client can get information about it

  | Status                | Description                                             |
  |---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------|
  | `OPEN` | Registered by claimer, but not yet read by the grantor |
  | `WAITING_RESOLUTION` | Readed by the grantor, waiting for his decision. |
  | `CONFIRMED` | Claim has been confirmed by the grantor. |
  | `CANCELLED` | Claim has been cancelled by the grantor or by the claimer. |
  | `DONE` | Claimer has been concluded the process. The key was migrated to him. |

## Claim Status Change Notification
As described in the status table, some statuses will fire a notification call to the client.
  To receive this notifications, its necessary to request the registration of the service URL which will receive the notification object.
  This object will be sent as an HTTP call with the POST method, of which the client must respond with a 200 status, a body confirming the delivery status and within 5 seconds.

  | Event Type          | Description                                               |
  |-------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------|
  | `claim_canceled_due_to_lack_of_validation` | The claim request was canceled due to lack of validation of ownership. |
  | `claim_canceled` | The request claim received has been cancelled. This means that the key remains linked to this participant. |
  | `claim_confirmed_due_to_deadline` | The claim request received was confirmed due to expiration. This means that the key is no longer linked to this participant, but the user can still cancel the claim of possession by the other user by fraud until the conclusion date limit. |
  | `claim_confirmed` | The claim for ownership has been confirmed by the grantor. This means that the active validation of the ownership of the key must be done, so that the request is completed after conclusion date limit. |
  | `claim_done` | The incoming claim request has been completed. This key is no longer tied to this participant. |
  | `claim_open` | A claim request was received. This means that another person has registered a request for this key to be linked to another account. To cancel this process and so that you can continue using this key, it is necessary that you make a new validation of ownership within 7 (seven) days. |
  | `claim_request_canceled` | The claim was refused. The person who registered this key confirmed that he still uses it. |
  | `claim_request_done` | The claim has been successfully completed. You can now use the key. |
  | `claim_request_received` | The claim request was received by the other participant. Will be waiting for the resolution by the other participant untilthe resolution date limit, period in which, if desired, the order can be canceled. |
  | `claim_waiting_ownership_validation` | Awaiting ownership validation for the claim request. |
  | `claim_waiting_resolution_limit` | Waiting for the incoming claim request to close. This means that the key is no longer linked to this participant, but the user can still cancel the claim of possession by the other user by fraud until the conclusion date limit. |
  | `claim_waiting_resolution` | Waiting for a response to the received claim request. This means that another person has requested for this key to be linked to another account. To cancel this process and so that you can continue using this key, it is necessary that you make a new validation of ownership within the resolution limit. |
  | `portability_canceled_due_to_deadline` | The request for portability received was canceled due to expiry of time. This means that the key remains linked to this participant. |
  | `portability_canceled` | The received portability request was cancelled. This means that the key remains linked to this participant. |
  | `portability_confirmed` | Portability performed. You can now use the key. |
  | `portability_done` | The received portability request has been completed. The key is no longer tied to this participant. |
  | `portability_open` | A portability request was received. This means that another participant has registered a request for this key to be linked to another account. To complete this process, confirmation is required within 7 (seven) days. |
  | `portability_request_done` | The request to change the key for this participant was refused. The portability was not completed, as we did not identify the confirmation at the home institution. |
  | `portability_request_received` | The request for portability was received by the other participant. Will be waiting for the resolution by the other participant until the resolution date limit, period in which, if desired, the order can be canceled. |
  | `portability_waiting_resolution` | Waiting for a response to the received portability request. This means that another participant has requested for this key to be linked to another account. To complete this process, your confirmation is required until the resolution date limit. |

**Notification Call Scheme**

  Headers:
  ```json
  {
    X-R4-Application: GUID // Application Unique Identifier
    X-R4-Delivery: GUID // Attempt Unique Identifier
    X-R4-Event: "{event_type}" // Event Type for the Notification (As described in the Claim Status Change Notification Table)
    User-Agent: R4-Hookshot
  }
  ```
  Body
  ```json
  {
    "object_kind": "{event_type}", Event Type for the Notification (As described in the Claim Status Change Notification Table)
    "object_id": "GUID", // Bill payment Unique Identifier
    "application_id": "GUID", // Application Unique Identifier
    "account_id": "GUID", // Account Unique Identifier
    "delivery_confirmation": true // Delivery confirmation response is required
  }
  ```

**Notification Response Scheme**

 HTTP status: `200`

 Body:
  ```json
  {
    "status": "CONFIRMED" // "REGISTERED", "SENT" or "CONFIRMED"
  }
  ```

# Errors
This service uses [HTTP response status codes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_HTTP_status_codes) to indicate the success or failure of your API requests.
In general, there are three status code ranges you can expect:

  - `2xx` success status codes confirm that your request worked as expected

  - `4xx` error status codes indicate an error because of the information provided (e.g., a required parameter was not provided)

  - `5xx` error status codes are rare and indicate an error with R4's servers


## HTTP Status code summary
Extracted from [Stripe API codes](https://stripe.com/docs/api/errors)

  - `200 - OK` Everything worked as expected.

  - `400 - Bad Request` The request was unacceptable, often due to missing a required parameter.

  - `401 - Unauthorized` No valid API key provided.

  - `403 - Forbidden` The API key doesn't have permissions to perform the request.

  - `404 - Not Found` The requested resource doesn't exist.

  - `429 - Too Many Requests` Too many requests hit the API too quickly. We recommend an exponential backoff of your requests.

  - `500, 502, 503, 504 - Server Errors` Something went wrong on R4's end.

## Error codes
Below is a list of possible error codes that can be returned:

  | Code                | Description                                                 |
  |-------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------|
  | `ACCOUNT_DISABLED` | The provided account has been disabled. |
  | `ACCOUNT_NOT_FOUND` | Account not found |
  | `APPLICATION_PRODUCT_NOT_FOUND` | Product not found for given application id |
  | `AUTHENTICATION_FAILED` | Authentication failed |
  | `CLAIM_ALREADY_BELONGS_TO_CLIENT` | The key already belongs to the client |
  | `CLAIM_ALREADY_DONE` | Claim was already completed |
  | `CLAIM_ALREADY_OPEN` | There is some claim with status different of done or cancelled for the revindicated key |
  | `CLAIM_CANCELATION_REASON_INVALID` | The reason to cancel your claim is not valid |
  | `CLAIM_CANNOT_BE_CANCELLED` | The status of your claim does not allow for its cancellation |
  | `CLAIM_CANNOT_BE_COMPLETED_BY_GRANTOR` | Claim cannot be completed by grantor |
  | `CLAIM_CANNOT_BE_CONFIRMED_BY_CLAIMER` | The claim cannot be confirmed by claimer |
  | `CLAIM_CANNOT_COMPLETE` | The status of your claim does not allow for its conclusion |
  | `CLAIM_INVALID` | There are an invalid field at creation of the claim |
  | `CLAIM_KEY_NOT_FOUND` | There is no registered bond to the key being claimed |
  | `CLAIM_NOT_FOUND` | The provided claim was not found or does not exist |
  | `CLAIM_TYPE_INCONSISTENT` | The requested claim type is inconsistent |
  | `ENTRY_LOCKED_BY_CLAIM` | There is a claim with a status other than completed or canceled for the key |
  | `IDEMPOTENCE_KEY_CONFLICT` | Two different contents have been sent with the same idempotence key |
  | `INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR` | Unexpected error with our service |
  | `INVALID_CELLPHONE` | The provided cellphone is not valid |
  | `INVALID_CNPJ` | The provided CNPJ is not valid |
  | `INVALID_CPF` | The provided CPF is not valid |
  | `INVALID_DATA` | The data provided has an invalid format |
  | `INVALID_EMAIL` | The provided email is not valid |
  | `INVALID_IDEMPOTENCE_KEY` | Idempotence Key is missing or is not a valid uuid. |
  | `KEY_ALREADY_EXISTS` | There is already a bond for this key with the same participant and owner |
  | `KEY_DATA_INCOMPLETE` | Incomplete data for key change. Inform "account type, account number and date and time of opening of the new account" and/or "name and nickname" |
  | `KEY_IN_CUSTODY_OF_DIFFERENT_PARTICIPANT` | There is already a bond for this key with other participant and owner. It is indicated a claim of ownership |
  | `KEY_LIMIT_EXCEEDED` | Number of links associated with transactional account exceeded maximum limit. |
  | `KEY_MISSING_ACCOUNT_OR_CUSTOMER` | It is necessary to inform a new account and/or customer name to change the address key |
  | `KEY_NICKNAME_INVALID` | The key to be changed does not accept nickname, as it is associated with the individual person type |
  | `KEY_NOT_FOUND` | The provided key is not found or does not exist |
  | `KEY_SAME_DOCUMENT_DIFFERENT_PSP` | This key is already linked to this document number, but in another PSP. Portability is recommended |
  | `KEY_WITH_DIFFERENT_ACCOUNT` | There is already a link for this key on with the same owner and other account information. A key change is indicated |
  | `KEY_WITH_SAME_DATA_INFORMED` | Data informed for key change is the same as the current data |
  | `MISSING_PRODUCT_PERMISSION` | Missing product permission |
  | `NO_KEY_LINKED_TO_ACCOUNT` | There arent key linked to the account informed |
  | `NO_KEY_LINKED_TO_DOCUMENT_NUMBER` | There arent key linked to the document number informed |
  | `PARTNERS_NOT_FOUND` | Partners was not found |
  | `RECEIVED_CLAIM_CANCELATION_RASON_INVALID` | The reason to cancel the claim you received is not valid |
  | `RECEIVED_CLAIM_CANNOT_BE_CANCELLED` | The status of the ownership claim you received does not allow for its cancellation |
  | `RECEIVED_CLAIM_CANNOT_BE_CONFIRMED` | The status of the claim you received, does not allow confirmation |
  | `RECEIVED_CLAIM_CONFIRM_REASON_INVALID` | The reason for confirming the claim you received is not valid |
  | `RECEIVED_OWNERSHIP_CANNOT_BE_CANCELLED` | The portability status you received does not allow its cancellation |
  | `UNAUTHORIZED` | Unauthorized |
  | `UNEXPECTED_ERROR` | Unexpected error with our service |
  | `VALIDATION_FAILED` | Invalid request data |

parameters.description: Unique account id

parameters.description: Get list of claims that account is the grantor

parameters.name: claimer
parameters.description: Get list of claims that account is the claimer

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Get only claims with specif status

parameters.name: claim_reason
parameters.description: Get only claims with specif reason

parameters.name: updated_start
parameters.description: Restricts the query to a date equal to or greater than the one entered

parameters.name: updated_end
parameters.description: Restricts the query to a date equal to or less than the one entered

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records per page

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number, if not informed the default will be 1
